class lenstronomy.Extensions.CosmoSampling.cosmo_solver.InvertCosmo(z_d, z_s)[source]¶

Bases: lenstronomy.Extensions.CosmoSampling.cosmo_solver.SolverUtil

class to do an interpolation and call the inverse of this interpolation to get H_0 and omega_m

get_cosmo(Dd, Ds_Dds)[source]¶

return the values of H0 and omega_m computed with an interpolation :param Dd: flat :param Ds_Dds: float :return:

make_interpolation()[source]¶

creates an interpolation grid in H_0, omega_m and computes quantities in Dd and Ds_Dds :return:

Bases: lenstronomy.Extensions.CosmoSampling.cosmo_solver.SolverUtil

class to solve multidimensional non-linear equations to determine the cosmological parameters H0 and omega_m given the angular diameter distance relations

lenstronomy.Extensions.CosmoSampling.time_delay_sampling module¶

class lenstronomy.Extensions.CosmoSampling.time_delay_sampling.TimeDelaySampling[source]¶

Bases: object

class for cosmology independent sampling

days_D_model(delay_arcsec, D_dt_model)[source]¶

given a delay in arcsec^2 and a Delay distance, the delay is computed in days :param delay_arc_sec: :param D_dt_model: :return:

logL_delays(delays_model, delays_measured, delays_errors)[source]¶

log likelihoood of modeled delays vs measured time delays under considerations of errors :param delays_model: n delays of the model (not relative delays) :param delays_measured: relative delays (1-2,1-3,1-4) relative to the first in the list :param delays_errors: gaussian errors on the measured delays :return: log likelihood of data given model
